Key Match Events: New Zealand ended their four-match losing run with a comprehensive five-wicket victory over Sri Lanka.
New Zealand bowled Sri Lanka out for 171 runs.
New Zealand chased down the 172-run target in less than 24 overs.
Rachin Ravindra took the final wicket to bowl Sri Lanka all out for 171.
Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra combined for 86 runs.
Angelo Mathews got rid of Kane Williamson on 14.
Mark Chapman was run out after confusion with Daryl Mitchell.
Daryl Mitchell scored an aggressive 43 before being caught by Charith Asalanka.
Glenn Phillips sealed the victory with a four.
Post-Match Reflections: The result means New Zealand have all but secured their place in the semi-finals.
Sri Lanka's defeat was their seventh from nine matches, ending their campaign and jeopardizing their qualification for the 2025 Champions Trophy.
